comments:
This deadlock happens when you import a Java project that has classpath 
problems. It is hard to reproduce since it apparently depends on timimg of 
different events. The threads participating in the deadlock:

Worker-7 thread is blocked inside WorkManager.lock.acquire method. Worker-8 has 
Workspace.run method twice on its stack. The deeper of the two stack frames is 
holding WorkManager.lock. Worker-8 thread is blocked waiting for the job 
executing on Worker-7 to finish.

Worker-7 should already own the lock it is blocked on (acquired in
AutoBuildJob.doBuild).  For some reason it seems to have lost the lock.  Are
there any errors in the .log file around the time this occurs?  Any more details
on reproducing would also be appreciated.

There are no errors in the log file. Here is another set of call stacks plus 
variables showing the state of the locks:

Created an attachment (id=16360)
Code illustrating a lock leak

I was able to simplify the code illustrating the problem to a degree when it 
can be attached here. The simplified code does not produce a deadlock but 
illustrates a lock leak.

Thanks for the test case!  This test cases verifies that this is a duplicate of
bug 76378.  This bug has been fixed.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 76378 ***
